Title.evidence: The Carotid Revascularization, Endarterectomy vs. Stenting Trial (CREST): A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised in a 1:1 ratio

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants included those with symptomatic carotid stenosis (≥50% by angiography, ≥70% by ultrasound) or asymptomatic stenosis (≥60% by angiography, ≥70% by ultrasound).

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised in a 1:1 ratio to receive either CAS or CEA.

Objective.evidence: The CREST trial evaluates the efficacy of carotid artery stenting (CAS) compared to carotid endarterectomy (CEA) in patients with carotid artery stenosis.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was a composite of stroke, myocardial infarction, and all-cause mortality during a 30-day peri-procedural period, and ipsilateral stroke over a follow-up period of up to 4 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment ensured.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 1,261 participants were randomised to each treatment group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis approach was not specified.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome's effect size, precision, and adverse events were not detailed in the abstract.

Harms.evidence: The primary outcome's effect size, precision, and adverse events were not detailed in the abstract.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Sponsored by the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (NINDS).
